title: Rudding Park and Crimple Valley Viaduct Walk Route

images.title: Charles Joynson / Saxon Cross and Rudding Park Gates
images.caption: Saxon Cross and Rudding Park Gates

images.title: Derek Harper / Disused viaduct over Crimple Beck
images.caption: Disused viaduct over Crimple Beck. There are two impressive viaducts across the Crimple valley on the south side of Harrogate. This one is on the disused Leeds Northern line between Starbeck and Pannal. Seen from the corner of the Crimple Valley golf course.

images.title: Derek Harper / Crimple
images.caption: Crimple. Mill Cottages at Crimple seen across a field from Crimple Lane.

images.title: Mtaylor848, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rudding Park Gates, Follifoot (24th December 2013)

images.title: DS Pugh / Old railway line
images.caption: Old railway line Underneath an arch of Crimple Viaduct that now carries the Harrogate line from Leeds, the course of the old railway line that skirted Harrogate can be seen. This line ran through to Starbeck without passing through Harrogate.

description: This walk takes you around Rudding Park to the photogenic Crimple Valley Viaduct on the outskirts of Harrogate. The walk starts in the little village of Follifoot where you can pick up a footpath heading north around the edge of Rudding Park. The park includes a Grade I listed Regency-style country house, a spa and an 18-hole golf course in the 18th-century parkland. You can stay at the hotel and enjoy a popular spa day here. Near the park you can link up with the Harrogate Ringway and follow the waymarked trail west through the Crimple Valley to the viaduct. It's a pretty area with woodland and weirs on the Crimple Beck leading you to the impressive railway structure.
